info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 10:33AM CDT until June 08 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 AM CDT FOR WESTERN CRAWFORD...NORTHEASTERN SEQUOYAH AND SOUTHEASTERN ADAIR COUNTIES... At 1032 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Natural Dam to near Short to 3 miles south of Brushy, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Van Buren... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Roland... Rudy... Figure Five... Brushy... Lee Creek... Short... Uniontown... Dora... Furry... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 6. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 324 and 328. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
